intro: Meniscium rostratum, commonly known as the rostrated meniscium, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a distinctive narrow, elongated shape. Meniscium rostratum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia, where it thrives in nutrient-rich soils.
